Sure, here's an example configuration for two overlay routers using OSPFv3, BGP, and VXLAN with an optimized route map for the best possible performance and fine-grain control over packet traversal.

Router 1 Configuration:
```kotlin
hostname overlay1
!
interface lo
 ip address 192.168.1.1/32
!
interface ens1f0
 no ip address
!
interface vxlan10
 vxlan id 10
 vxlan local-tunnelip 192.168.100.1
 vxlan remote-tunnelip 192.168.100.2
 vxlan udp-port 4789
 vxlan flood vtep
!
interface vlan100
 ip address 10.0.1.1/24
!
interface vlan200
 ip address 10.0.2.1/24
!
router ospfv3
 router-id 192.168.1.1
 passive-interface default
 no passive-interface vlan100
 no passive-interface vlan200
!
router bgp 65001
 bgp router-id 192.168.1.1
 neighbor 192.168.100.2 remote-as 65002
 !
 address-family ipv4 unicast
  neighbor 192.168.100.2 activate
  network 10.0.1.0/24
  network 10.0.2.0/24
 exit-address-family
!
route-map optimize permit 10
 match ip address prefix-list optimize
 set local-preference 200
!
ip prefix-list optimize seq 10 permit 10.0.1.0/24
ip prefix-list optimize seq 20 permit 10.0.2.0/24
```
Router 2 Configuration:
```kotlin
hostname overlay2
!
interface lo
 ip address 192.168.1.2/32
!
interface ens1f0
 no ip address
!
interface vxlan10
 vxlan id 10
 vxlan local-tunnelip 192.168.100.2
 vxlan remote-tunnelip 192.168.100.1
 vxlan udp-port 4789
 vxlan flood vtep
!
interface vlan100
 ip address 10.0.1.2/24
!
interface vlan200
 ip address 10.0.2.2/24
!
router ospfv3
 router-id 192.168.1.2
 passive-interface default
 no passive-interface vlan100
 no passive-interface vlan200
!
router bgp 65002
 bgp router-id 192.168.1.2
 neighbor 192.168.100.1 remote-as 65001
 !
 address-family ipv4 unicast
  neighbor 192.168.100.1 activate
  network 10.0.1.0/24
  network 10.0.2.0/24
 exit-address-family
!
route-map optimize permit 10
 match ip address prefix-list optimize
 set local-preference 200
!
ip prefix-list optimize seq 10 permit 10.0.1.0/24
ip prefix-list optimize seq 20 permit 10.0.2.0/24
```
In this configuration, both routers are configured with OSPFv3, BGP, and VXLAN. The VXLAN tunnel is established between the two routers over the ens1f0 interface. The route map is used to optimize the traffic flow and fine-grain control over the packet traversal. The prefixes 10.0.1.0/24 and 10.0.2.0/24 are permitted in the prefix list, and a local preference of 200 is set for
